resources.string: * You beat your previous best of %1$s
* You beat your previous best of %1$d guesses
You\'ve been challenged to deduce a word:
Your challenger was able to solve it in:
Your challenger gave up before they could solve it.
Your challenger has chosen to share their guesses with you.
Your challenger has chosen to share their deductions with you.
Your challenger has chosen to share their guesses and deductions with you.
You must complete the challenge with only the guesses provided by your challenger.
You have a game in progress. Accepting this challenge will delete that game.
Challenge a friend to deduce this word faster or more efficiently than you could
Challenge a friend to deduce the word you couldn\'t
Turn this off if you want to challenge them to deduce the word using only the exact same guesses as you
Turn this on if you want them to see all the guesses you made
Turn this on if you want them to see all the deductions (letter coloring) you\'ve made
You gave up after %1$d guesses in %2$s
You guessed the secret word on your first try. There\'s only a 1 in %1$d chance of that happening
But you probably don\'t care since you didn\'t even try
To make it easier to keep track of which letters you think are in the secret word, you can long press on a letter and set it\'s color.
Guess the secret word. With every guess, you will be told how many letters your guess shares with the secret word.
If the secret word is \"GUEST\" and you guess \"SEATS\" you\'ll be told that there are 3 matching letters, since both words have an E, an S, and a T. The duplicate S does not count twice.
Experiencing an issue or have other feedback? Contact me:
You can submit a bug report or view the source code on GitHub

I wanted this app to be completely offline and collect no data. Unfortunately, collecting some amount of data is unavoidable. I added something made by Google called Firebase Crashlytics. When the app crashes, it collects some information about your phone (such as the manufacturer and model number) and submits it to Google along with some info for me about what exactly the app was trying to do when it crashed. Without this, it would be impossible for me to detect or fix any issues with the app.

Come up with a set of words to guess that cover almost all letters of the alphabet with minimal repeats. This will give you a strong base to begin making deductions from.\nThis example game shows 5 guesses that have covered 24 possible letters. Try selecting the most common letter(s) from each and using them to guess a word. This should quickly help you narrow down the correct letters.
Make guesses that give maximal information

In this example game, you will see that there are 4 letters that might be in the solution. You can break this down into 2 pairs. Choose one letter from each pair and guess a word with it. This will immediately narrow down which 2 of the 4 letters are correct.
Learn to play better by completing challenge lessons
